009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
019import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
020import imagingbook.common.math.eigen.GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition;
021
022/**
023 * <p>
024 * Algebraic ellipse fit based on Taubin's method [1].
025 * Version 2 uses a reduced scatter and constraint matrix (5x5),
026 * the solution is found by generalized symmetric eigendecomposition.
027 * See [3, Sec. 11.2.1] for a detailed description (Alg. 11.8).
028 * This implementation performs data centering or, alternatively, accepts
029 * a specific reference point.
030 * </p>
031 * <p>
032 * [1] G. Taubin, G. Taubin. "Estimation of planar curves, surfaces, and
033 * nonplanar space curves defined by implicit equations with applications to
034 * edge and range image segmentation", IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and
035 * Machine Intelligence 13(11), 1115â€“1138 (1991).
036 * <br>
037 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 
038 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
039 * </p>
040 * 
041 * @author WB
042 * @version 2021/11/09
043 * @see EllipseFitTaubin1
044 */
045public class EllipseFitTaubin2 implements EllipseFitAlgebraic {
046        
047        private final double[] q;       // = (A,B,C,D,E,F) ellipse parameters
048        
049        public EllipseFitTaubin2(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
050                if (points.length < 5) {
051                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 5 points must be supplied for ellipse fitting");
052                }
053                this.q = fit(points, xref);
054                
055        }
056        
057        public EllipseFitTaubin2(Pnt2d[] points) {
058                this(points, PntUtils.centroid(points));
059        }
060
061        @Override
062        public double[] getParameters() {
063                return this.q;
064        }
065        
066        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
067        
068        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
069                final int n = points.length;
070                
071                // reference point
072                final double xr = xref.getX();
073                final double yr = xref.getY();
074
075                // design matrix (same as Fitzgibbon):
076                RealMatrix X = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(n, 6);
077                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
078                        final double x = points[i].getX() - xr; // center data set
079                        final double y = points[i].getY() - yr;
080                        double[] fi = {sqr(x), x*y, sqr(y), x, y, 1};
081                        X.setRow(i, fi);
082                }
083                
084                // scatter matrix S (normalized by 1/n)
085                RealMatrix S = X.transpose().multiply(X).scalarMultiply(1.0/n);
086                RealMatrix S1 = S.getSubMatrix(0, 4, 0, 4);
087                RealVector s5 = S.getColumnVector(5).getSubVector(0, 5);
088
089                RealMatrix P = S1.subtract(s5.outerProduct(s5));
090        
091                double a = S.getEntry(0, 5);
092                double b = S.getEntry(2, 5);
093                double c = S.getEntry(1, 5);
094                double d = S.getEntry(3, 5);
095                double e = S.getEntry(4, 5);
096                
097                // constraint matrix:
098                RealMatrix Q = Matrix.makeRealMatrix(5, 5, 
099                                4*a, 2*c, 0,   2*d, 0,
100                                2*c, a+b, 2*c, e,   d, 
101                                0,   2*c, 4*b, 0,   2*e,
102                                2*d, e,   0,   1,   0,
103                                0,   d,   2*e, 0,   1);
104                
105                GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition eigen = new GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition(P, Q);
106                
107                double[] evals = eigen.getRealEigenvalues();
108                
109                int k = getSmallestPositiveIdx(evals);                  
110                RealVector q0 = eigen.getEigenvector(k);
111                
112                double f = -s5.dotProduct(q0);
113                double[] qopt = q0.append(f).toArray();
114                
115                RealMatrix U = getDataOffsetCorrectionMatrix(xr, yr);
116                return U.operate(qopt);
117        }
118        
119        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
120        
121        private int getSmallestPositiveIdx(double[] x) {
122                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
123                int minidx = -1;
124                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
125                        if (x[i] >= 0 && x[i] < minval) {
126                                minval = x[i];
127                                minidx = i;
128                        }
129                }
130                return minidx;
131        }
132        
133}
